title: Deus Ex: Human Revolution
notes: Didn't play for long but seems to work perfectly, just like wine+dxvk.

title: Deus Ex: Human Revolution
notes: Started the game in DirectX 9 mode with no tesselation, but otherwise all settings were on their maximums.  Game started up and loaded into a new game successfully, although after a long load time.  Unfortunately, there is frequent stuttering during all non-cutscene gameplay. I tried lowering or turning off every video option outside of screen resolution.  No luck.

title: Deus Ex: Human Revolution
notes: Only i can launch gameplay in windowed mode.But i can set fullscreen with alt+enter and game works.Frame drops often but game works

title: Deus Ex: Human Revolution
notes: Sometimes dropping a few frames but works perfect on DX11

title: Deus Ex: Human Revolution
notes: Very minor occasional stuttering. Crashes on game exit. Plays great otherwise.

title: Deus Ex: Human Revolution
notes: Very long load times, sometimes has to be manually killed, and huge dips in fps, which can be triggered just by turning around. Putting the graphics settings at their lowest can improve this, but it's still a big problem. It doesn't crash and it's technically functional, but it's still unplayable as a game. HOWEVER, these performance issues can be almost entirely eliminated by setting "PROTON_NO_D3D11=1 %command%" as a launch option. Even with the graphics cranked all the way up, fps dips become almost unnoticeable. Almost. One final note: with said launch option, the slight fps dips are always slight, regardless of the graphics settings.

title: Deus Ex: Human Revolution
notes: No DX11 support, DX9 works but is slower than DX11 renderer on Windows.,

title: Deus Ex: Human Revolution
notes: Crashed on exit, some minor stuttering from time to time. Plays great though.
